name: Fish with Spicy Salsa
description: Super fast to prepare, this is a light, fresh, healthy dinner that's a satisfying meal for less than 500 calories. By setting the salsa aside, it sweats and the juices become the "sauce" for this recipe without the need to use tons of oil! I made this spicy - Salsa Picante (which means spicy) - but you can just as just omit the chili if you prefer! I added eggplant slices to fill this out, add nutrition and interest to the dish - but this is optional.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 tsp fresh chili (, finely chopped (or 1/4 tsp red pepper flakes))

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the Spicy Salsa ingredients except basil in a bowl. Set aside for 20 minutes to sweat so juices seep and the tomatoes soften.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine the Spicy Salsa ingredients except basil in a bowl. Set aside for 20 minutes to sweat so juices seep and the tomatoes soften.

recipeInstructions.text: Season eggplant and fish generously with salt and pepper. Then dust fish with flour, shaking off excess.
recipeInstructions.name: Season eggplant and fish generously with salt and pepper. Then dust fish with flour, shaking off excess.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat 1/2 tbsp oil in a non stick skillet over high heat. Add the eggplant and cook each side until charred and softened - about 2 minutes first side, 1 1/2 minutes second side. Remove onto a plate.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat 1/2 tbsp oil in a non stick skillet over high heat. Add the eggplant and cook each side until charred and softened - about 2 minutes first side, 1 1/2 minutes second side. Remove onto a plate.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat remaining oil. Add fish and cook until light golden on both sides, pressing down with an egg flip to brown it evenly.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat remaining oil. Add fish and cook until light golden on both sides, pressing down with an egg flip to brown it evenly.

recipeInstructions.text: Tear basil leaves with your hands and toss through the salsa.
recipeInstructions.name: Tear basil leaves with your hands and toss through the salsa.

recipeInstructions.text: To serve, place 3 eggplants on each plate, top with a piece of fish and spoon over the salsa + juices. Serve with toasted sourdough on the side.
recipeInstructions.name: To serve, place 3 eggplants on each plate, top with a piece of fish and spoon over the salsa + juices. Serve with toasted sourdough on the side.

I love the idea of LITE recipes :) Will look forward to them on your blog! This fish looks amazing-- great summer flavors.

keywords: fish with salsa, healthy fish recipe
